subtitle: I was very excited by the theme of this
year's conference the edge of the
unknown because to me not knowing the
openness of not knowing is at the very
heart of what this is all about it seems
to me that not knowing is at the heart
of how science operates and it's at the
heart of spiritual awakening and I
titled this talk the freedom of nothing
to grasp because in my experience
freedom love peace joy is found when the
grasping mind relaxes and there are many
words for that openness surrendering
melting dissolving
and as I see it this whole spiritual
thing boils down to something incredibly
simple it boils down to right here right
now being awake right here right now or
as someone famously said being here now
and of course in the beginning that
seems like a kind of practice or path in
which we kind of shift our attention
from the thoughts and mental movies and
stories and beliefs to the simplicity of
their perceiving
sensing breathing hearing seeing
smelling tasting just the sensory
reality of this moment and also we begin
to be aware of the thinking mind and
what kinds of thought patterns are
running through the mind and we begin to
see how we do our suffering we begin to
see how suffering happens we begin to
notice patterns like always thinking
about the future or always thinking
about the past or telling ourselves the
story that we've ruined our whole life
or whatever it is and the more clearly
we see the mechanism of our suffering
the more it dissolves naturally by
itself it doesn't really work to go to
war with our suffering or to try to get
rid of the self or to try to get rid of
all of our difficulties and so on
it's more like just seeing them clearly
they naturally dissolve not necessarily
on the timetable we have in mind
and they always dissolve now they can't
dissolve at any other time so if we're
waiting for them to dissolve in the
future that's suffering or if we're
remembering how they did dissolve once
in the past that's suffering they can
only really dissolve right now and they
can't dissolve by us trying to make them
dissolve because that's that's really
just thought masquerading is me the
little self trying to make this happen
it's more about just seeing the whole
thing and allowing it to dissolve by
itself and if it doesn't dissolve if
there's some pattern that's just
persistent than just being with that
just letting that be as it is and the
more we stop fighting it and just allow
it to be here and see it clearly the
less power it has and the more it begins
to open up on its own and eventually we
come to realize that being here now
while it started out seeming like a kind
of path or practice is actually a
description of the nature of reality
that in fact we can't not be here now
here now is all there is here now is our
true nature the true nature of
everything and by here now I don't mean
San Jose California on Sunday afternoon
because that's appearing here now what I
mean by here now is this timeless place
'less eternal present that never leaves
no matter what time of day is showing up
no matter what
season of the year it is no matter how
old we are it's always showing up now
have you noticed that and no matter what
location is showing up whether it's San
Jose or the airport or Paris or Oregon
or whatever it's always showing up here
in this present we're always here and
it's always now so that's the very
nature of reality being here now and we
can't ever actually leave here now we
can have thoughts about the future and
memories of the past and thoughts about
somewhere else but they all arise here
now and the more we give attention to
here now well there's a wonderful
discovery that keeps happening and as
far as I know there's no end to that
discovery just finding out that when you
bring your attention to the present
moment to what's actually happening here
now it doesn't have the kind of solidity
and continuity of forms that it seems to
have when we're thinking about it you
know when you actually we have a word
like my body and then it seems like
that's some solid thing my body but when
we actually pay attention to the body
just tune into the body with awareness
we find something that isn't solid at
all it's ever-changing sensations
movement it's fluid its inseparable it's
permeable inseparable inseparable from
everything around it and that's true of
everything
so when we really give open attention to
here now we discover fluidity and
evermore subtlety and openness and we
discover also that here now is always
here so it's both ever-present and
ever-changing
and we're always kind of looking for
something to get hold of aren't we I
mean we're always kind of looking for
the answer the final understanding or
maybe the ultimate experience the great
breakthrough final enlightenment the
finish line something to grasp and yet I
don't know if you've noticed but
everything that we grasp turns out to be
disappointing or unsatisfying in some
way ultimately may initially be
satisfying but sooner or later it begins
to disappoint us or be unsatisfying in
some way and we can't really grasp
anything either because as Heraclitus
said we what did he say we never step
into the same river twice and we're not
the same stepper from one second to the
next
we're more like whirlpools than we are
like solid things and so anything we try
to grasp it's like trying to grasp
clouds or smoke we can't really get hold
of anything so if we're trying to get
hold of something that we call love or
happiness I mean on a practical level we
can grasp things like a you know a chair
and that's functional but I'm talking
about love peace happiness freedom we
can't grasp those things they're there
they're there when we when the grasping
falls away they're the natural state as
it were that's there when the grasping
falls away
they're the nature peace
Lovejoy freedom all those nice sounding
words that's the nature of here now
that's the nature of this awaring
presence that we are and when we tune
into this awaring presence it's not Maya
wearing presence or you're wearing
presence it's undivided it's seamless
its whole its includes everything all of
this whole room all of these different
shapes and colors and forms and people
and chairs are appearing in this vast
spacious of wearing presence that we are
when I was a Zen student years ago we
used to have to sit these long sessions
where you had to you know you had to sit
in the lotus position for days on end
and you'd be an excruciating pain and
one of the things I learned from that is
that if you resist the pain it gets
worse and worse and worse and worse but
if you just relax into it and completely
bring your attention into it and just
open into it suddenly it's not really
painful anymore and it starts to shift
and move and dissolve and that is true
of emotional pain as well when we really
instead of thinking about it and telling
the story about it when we just really
come back to being with the sensory
experiencing of it something shifts it's
a little dangerous to say that because
the mind then wants to you know do that
so that it will shift which doesn't
really work it's more like just
accepting and allowing everything to be
the way it is and recognizing that
that's actually something that we it's
not like we have to do that that is the
very nature of awareness that is the
very nature of here now to allow
everything to be as it is obviously
because it is as it is so I'm a very
ordinary person you know really as in my
experience and a lot of people have
these dramatic awakenings like you know
Eckhart Tolle where one they're all
depressed and having a horrible time and
then they have this one night where
everything falls away apparently more or

chasing after some kind of final
enlightenment
and grasping at that you know and trying
to figure out what all these people had
that I didn't have or what they had lost
that I still had blah blah blah and
finally I realized that that whole

about this fictional little person that
we think is authoring our thoughts
making our choices living our life I'm
not saying there's nothing here that we
call Joan Collison there definitely but
it's like a whirlpool it's a pattern of
energy that changes from second a second
a second there's nothing solid about it
and it's like the wave on the ocean it's

the other waves so yes there is
something that we call Joan Collison but
it's nothing you can get hold of or

but but what we talking about when we
say there's no self or when we're

this separate unit of consciousness
that's stuck inside this body looking
out at an alien world out there and the

so I realized that the whole search for

but just because the whole thing melted

this there's just this and you know
sometimes the weather here is cloudy and

it's like the weather outside it's the

sleep apnea there's 10 million things
